channel.title: Anyone know how to make it say "[Owner] (playername) has logged in."?

item.title: Anyone know how to make it say "[Owner] (playername) has logged in."?
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

Waffles!!:

Nope, it’s for that name only.

I get the following error;

client.java:10572: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable playerHandler
location: class client
playerHandler.messageToAll = “[Owner]”+playerName+" has logged in.";
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know how to make it say "[Owner] (playername) has logged in."?

item.title: Anyone know how to make it say "[Owner] (playername) has logged in."?
item.dc:creator: @jags_4 jags 4
item.description:
@jags_4 wrote:

Depends what source your using… but go to client.java and ctrl+f search for “GetItemName(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]));”

After that hit space 2 times then copy and paste this in…

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“jags 4”))
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “OMFG JAGS 4 HAS LOGGED ON! REPLACEMENT FOR OWNED… YOU GOT JAGGED!!”;

Try that

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone know how to make it say "[Owner] (playername) has logged in."?
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

[quote=“Waffles!!, post:2, topic:160717”]In the login procedure:
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Owner”)) {
playerHandler.messageToAll("[Owner]"+playerName+" has logged in.");
}

Something like that; havn’t done this in ages.[/quote]

I’ll test that, but wouldn’t I need to have something in there saying “if(playerrights = 3” or something?

Read full topic
